Introduction      How to use      Submit new kappa

Welcome to the kappa repository. The repository contains a summary of experimentally derived values for kappa from hygroscopic growth and cloud droplet activation data. The database includes relevant information regarding molecular structure, experimental methods, and original data sources.

This database originated from the need to collate experimental data that was collected from DOE (PIs Ziemann, Kreidenweis, and Petters) and NERC (PIs Reid and Clegg) funded projects. Funding for the database was made possible with support from both agencies. The database is that maintained by Markus Petters. Submission of similar peer-reviewed data is invited and encouraged. Please direct questions, including those regarding content or the submission process, to hygroscopicity.database@gmail.com.

What is kappa?
Kappa is as a single parameter representation of hygroscopic growth and cloud condensation nucleus activity. It can be derived directly from experimental data as described in Petters and Kreidenweis (2007)

Reference
Petters, M. D. and Kreidenweis, S. M.: A single parameter representation of hygroscopic growth and cloud condensation nucleus activity, Atmos. Chem. Phys., 7, 1961-1971, https://doi.org/10.5194/acp-7-1961-2007, 2007.

Why a database?
The list of papers containing experimentally derived values of kappa is continually growing. This database is intended to be a central repository for kappa values to facilitate literature review and identify future research questions.
